metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23614 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Twig is an open source template language for PHP. When in a sandbox mode,the `arrow` parameter of the `sort` filter must be a closure to avoidattackers being able to run arbitrary PHP functions. In affected versionsthis constraint was not properly enforced and could lead to code injectionof arbitrary PHP code. Patched versions now disallow calling non Closure inthe `sort` filter as is the case for some other filters. Users are advisedto upgrade.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23614` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-twig - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-cache-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-cssinliner-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-extra-bundle - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-html-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-inky-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-intl-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-markdown-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
php-twig-string-extra - 3.3.8-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-twig package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-2ubuntu4').
